tools/regionreassembler.c

00038 /**
00039  * \file regionreassembler.c
00040  * \brief if have run subsetter with promote, works on out exodus
00041  *        file to copy var back to the main mesh using the map
00042  *
00043  *  reads in geom file and subsequent file where we have promoted
00044  *  meshes with well known naming convention (has timestep and segment id)
00045  *  and mappings for the orig mesh. reconsititutes all the vars from these
00046  *  promoted meshed onto the main mesh and fills in all the missing data points
00047  *  with value 0;
00048  *
00049  *  note: we cannot distinguish what were vars vs seqvars
00050  *  on the original mesh, so everything is treated as a step in a seqvar
00051  *
00052  *  writes the reassembled output to the named output file or to
00053  *  reassmebled.ex2
00054  *
00055  * \modifications
00056  *   - 04/26/08 ACG 
00057  *   - 06/20/08 ACG revised becuase of changes to subsetter
00058  *   - 07/13/08 ACG revised becuase of changes to subsetter
00059  *   - 08/11/08 ACG hardening
00060  */
00061 
00062 #include <string.h>
00063 #include "exodusII.h"
00064 #include "fc.h"
00065 
00066 static FC_Dataset ds;
00067 static FC_Dataset rds;
00068 
00069 static FC_VerbosityLevel verbose_level = FC_QUIET;
00070 static char* geom_file_name = NULL;
00071 static char* reduced_file_name = NULL;
00072 static char* outfile = NULL;
00073 // this is the fill val. can change this to be asked for and/or per variable 
00074 static int* fillval = 0; 
00075 
00076 static void getArgs(int, char**);
00077 static int getMatchingMesh(char* origname,FC_Mesh **mainmeshes, int numMainMesh, 
00078                   int *imainmesh, int *timestep);
00079 
00080 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00081   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00082   int i,j;
00083   int numMesh, numMainMesh;
00084   FC_Mesh *meshes, *mainmeshes;
00085   FC_Sequence *seqs;
00086   int numseq, numstep;
00087 
00088   getArgs(argc, argv);
00089 
00090   // init library and load dataset
00091   rc = fc_setLibraryVerbosity(verbose_level);
00092   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00093   rc = fc_initLibrary();
00094   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00095   rc = fc_loadDataset(geom_file_name, &ds);
00096   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"Can't load dataset\n");
00097 
00098   rc = fc_loadDataset(reduced_file_name, &rds);
00099   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"Can't load dataset\n");
00100 
00101   // get meshes
00102   rc = fc_getMeshes(ds, &numMainMesh, &mainmeshes);
00103   if (numMainMesh < 1){
00104     printf("No mainmeshes were found\n");
00105     fflush(NULL);
00106     exit(0);
00107   } else {
00108     printf("%d main meshes\n", numMainMesh);
00109     fflush(NULL);
00110   }
00111 
00112   rc = fc_getMeshes(rds, &numMesh, &meshes);
00113   if (numMesh < 1){
00114     printf("No meshes were found\n");
00115     fflush(NULL);
00116     exit(0);
00117   } else {
00118     printf("%d reduced meshes\n", numMesh);
00119     fflush(NULL);
00120   }
00121 
00122   //there must be a unique seq on the main mesh dataset for reconstituting
00123   rc = fc_getSequences(ds,&numseq,&seqs);
00124   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "Can't get sequence upon which to reconstitute");
00125   if (numseq != 1){
00126     fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(FC_ERROR, "Can't get unique sequence upon which to reconstitute");
00127   }
00128   rc = fc_getSequenceNumStep(seqs[0],&numstep);
00129   fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc, "Can't get sequence numstep");
00130 
00131 
00132   // loop over meshes
00133   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
00134     FC_Variable *reducedvars;
00135     int numreducedvars;
00136     int imainmesh;
00137     int timestep;
00138     char* origname;
00139     char* mainname;
00140 
00141     //    printf("mesh %d\n",i);
00142     
00143     rc = fc_getMeshName(meshes[i], &origname);
00144     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00145       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh by name");
00146       continue;
00147     }
00148 
00149     getMatchingMesh(origname,&mainmeshes,numMainMesh, 
00150               &imainmesh, &timestep);
00151     if (imainmesh == -1 || timestep == -1){
00152       printf("mesh <%s> does not match a main mesh\n",origname);
00153       free(origname);
00154       continue;
00155     } 
00156 
00157     rc = fc_getMeshName(mainmeshes[imainmesh], &mainname);
00158     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00159       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh by name");
00160       continue;
00161     }
00162     
00163     printf("mesh <%s> matches mainmesh <%s> at timestep <%d>\n", origname, mainname, timestep);
00164     free(mainname);
00165     free(origname);
00166 
00167     //if we dont have a seq var with this name make one.
00168     //then put the var data in the existing var at the correct step.
00169     
00170     //get only basic vars
00171     rc = fc_getVariables(meshes[i],&numreducedvars,&reducedvars);
00172     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00173       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get vars from mesh");
00174       continue;
00175     }
00176 
00177     for (j = 0; j < numreducedvars; j++){
00178       char* currvarname;
00179       FC_Variable *dest_seqvar;
00180       FC_AssociationType assoc;
00181       FC_Variable *mapvars;
00182       int nummapvar;
00183       
00184       rc = fc_getVariableName(reducedvars[j],&currvarname);
00185       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00186      fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get var name");
00187      continue;
00188       }
00189       //      printf("Considering var <%s>\n",currvarname);
00190       
00191       //skip for exodus if var is ID, or if it is a mapping var)
00192       if (strcmp(currvarname, "ID") == 0 ||
00193        strcmp(currvarname,"FC_ELEMENTMAP") == 0 ||
00194        strcmp(currvarname,"FC_VERTEXMAP") == 0){
00195      fc_printfWarningMessage("not copying over var '%s'",currvarname);
00196      free(currvarname);
00197      continue;
00198       }
00199 
00200       rc = fc_getVariableAssociationType(reducedvars[j], &assoc);
00201       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00202      fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"can't get var assoc type");
00203       }
00204       switch(assoc){
00205       case FC_AT_ELEMENT:
00206      rc = fc_getVariableByName(meshes[i],"FC_ELEMENTMAP",&nummapvar,&mapvars);
00207      fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"Can't get elem map var");
00208      break;
00209       case FC_AT_VERTEX:
00210      rc = fc_getVariableByName(meshes[i],"FC_VERTEXMAP",&nummapvar,&mapvars);
00211      fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(rc,"Can't get vertex map var");
00212      break;
00213       default:
00214      fc_printfWarningMessage("Wont copy basic vars of type %d", assoc);
00215      free(currvarname);
00216      continue;
00217       }
00218       if (nummapvar != 1){
00219      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get map var");
00220      exit(0);
00221       }
00222 
00223       printf("Reassembling var <%s> at timestep %d\n",currvarname,timestep);
00224       rc = fc_copySeqVariableStepFromRegionMesh(reducedvars[j],
00225                               mainmeshes[imainmesh],
00226                               seqs[0],
00227                               timestep,
00228                               mapvars[0],
00229                               fillval,
00230                               currvarname,
00231                               &dest_seqvar);
00232       free(dest_seqvar);
00233       free(currvarname);
00234       free(mapvars);
00235     } //reduced vars
00236     free(reducedvars);
00237   } //nummesh
00238   
00239   free(meshes);
00240   free(mainmeshes);
00241   free(seqs);
00242 
00243 
00244   if (outfile != NULL){
00245     rc = fc_rewriteDataset(ds, outfile, FC_FT_EXODUS);
00246   } else {
00247     //    printf("trying to write to a different file\n");
00248     rc = fc_rewriteDataset(ds, "reassembled.ex2", FC_FT_EXODUS);
00249   }
00250   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00251 
00252   rc = fc_deleteDataset(ds);
00253   rc = fc_deleteDataset(rds);
00254   fc_exitIfError(rc);
00255 
00256   fc_finalLibrary();
00257   exit(0);
00258 }
00259 
00260 
00261 int getMatchingMesh(char* origname,FC_Mesh **mainmeshes, int numMainMesh, 
00262               int *imainmesh, int *timestep){
00263 
00264   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00265   int i;
00266 
00267   //now looking for names like mainmeshname_T#_Seg#
00268   //where T is the timestep and Seg# is segment at that timestep.    
00269   //if it has the right naming convention then this is a mesh we want
00270   
00271   //defaults
00272   *imainmesh = -1;
00273   *timestep = -1;
00274 
00275   for (i = 0; i < numMainMesh; i++){
00276     char* mainname;
00277     rc = fc_getMeshName((*mainmeshes)[i],&mainname);
00278     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
00279       fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh by name");
00280       continue;
00281     }
00282 
00283     //    printf("comparing <%s>(%d) with <%s>(%d)\n",origname,strlen(origname),
00284     //       mainname, strlen(mainname));
00285     //origname must be at least mainname_T#_Seg#
00286     if (strncmp(origname,mainname,strlen(mainname)) == 0 &&
00287      strlen(origname) >= strlen(mainname)+7 &&
00288      origname[strlen(mainname)] == '_' &&
00289      origname[strlen(mainname)+1] == 'T'){
00290 
00291       char holdnum[10]; //FIXME: this cant be fixed
00292       int lindex = strlen(mainname)+2;
00293       int currdigit = 0;
00294 
00295       //      printf("matched base now looking for number\n");
00296       while(strlen(origname) >= (uint)(lindex+5)){
00297      if (origname[lindex] != '_'){
00298        //FIXME -- is there a regex thing I can use?
00299        //   printf("eval <%c>\n",origname[lindex]);
00300        holdnum[currdigit++] = origname[lindex++];
00301        if (currdigit > 8){ //leave room for the \0
00302          fc_exitIfErrorPrintf(FC_ERROR,"Programmer error - cannot handle timestep size");
00303        }
00304      } else {
00305        //FIXME - should check rest of name
00306        //now we have a match
00307        char* endptr;
00308        long lcheck;
00309        holdnum[currdigit] = '\0';
00310        
00311        lcheck = strtol(holdnum, &endptr, 10);
00312        if (*endptr == '\0'){ // its a number
00313          *timestep = (int)lcheck;
00314          //        printf("timestep = <%d>\n",*timestep);
00315          *imainmesh = i;
00316          free(mainname);
00317          return 1;
00318        } //else its not a number
00319        break;
00320      }
00321       }
00322     } //checked against this meshname
00323     
00324     free(mainname);
00325     
00326   } //loop over main meshes
00327 
00328   return 0;
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 void getArgs(int argc, char** argv){
00333   // handle arguments
00334   int i;
00335 
00336   if (argc < 2) {
00337   usage:
00338     printf("usage: %s [options] geomdataset reducedmeshesdataset \n", argv[0]);
00339     printf("options: \n");
00340     printf("   -h           : print this help message\n");
00341     printf("   -v           : verbose: print warning and error messages\n");
00342     printf("   -V           : very verbose: print log and error messages\n");
00343     printf("   -o outfile   : outfile (exodus) \n");
00344     printf("\n");
00345     printf("\n");
00346     fflush(NULL);
00347     exit(-1);
00348   }
00349   
00350   for (i = 1; i < argc; i++) {
00351     if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-v")) {
00352       verbose_level = FC_WARNING_MESSAGES;
00353     }
00354     else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-V")) {
00355       verbose_level = FC_LOG_MESSAGES;
00356     }
00357     else if (!strcmp(argv[i], "-o")){
00358       if (i+1 > argc)
00359      goto usage;
00360       outfile = argv[++i];
00361     }
00362     else if (!strncmp(argv[i], "-h", 2) || !strncmp(argv[i], "-", 1))
00363       goto usage;
00364     else {
00365       if (i+2 > argc)
00366         goto usage;
00367       geom_file_name = argv[i];
00368       reduced_file_name = argv[i+1];
00369       i+=2;
00370     }
00371   }
00372   if (!geom_file_name || !reduced_file_name )
00373     goto usage;
00374 }
